Posted By: rinoh20 (12/31/2010 12:48:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I don't believe it was intended to be fair. Way back when, there weren't online spoilers, public information regarding print runs, and the game had a much smaller fan base. Players weren't expected to know as much about the game, and they certainly weren't expected to buy the cards in the quantity that they did. The designers wanted it to be an epic (and infrequent) experience for someone to crush his opponent with a card like Time Walk or Black Lotus. There would be rumors circulating about that 'insane card' that was rumored to exist, but perhaps none of your friends had actually seen--it was almost as if they were shooting for a Mythic Rare status from the beginning.
posts.html:
I don't believe it was intended to be fair. Way back when, there weren't online spoilers, public information regarding print runs, and the game had a much smaller fan base. Players weren't expected to know as much about the game, and they certainly weren't expected to buy the cards in the quantity that they did. The designers wanted it to be an epic (and infrequent) experience for someone to crush his opponent with a card like Time Walk or Black Lotus. There would be rumors circulating about that 'insane card' that was rumored to exist, but perhaps none of your friends had actually seen--it was almost as if they were shooting for a Mythic Rare status from the beginning.

posts.post_content:
Just use [Izzet Chronarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Chronarch) to return this to your hand or [Izzet Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Guildmage) to duplicate this thing. I also think WotC obviously thought this was too overpowered and created a [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp) instead.
  
   
Make a deck with these in Vintage:
  
1 [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk)   
4 [Walk the Aeons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walk the Aeons)   
4 [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp)   
4 [Reminisce](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reminisce)   
1 [Timetwister](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timetwister)   
4 [Time Stretch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stretch)   
4 [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop)   
(And other stuff)
  
You can guarantee your opponent won't have a great TIME.
  
   
Anyway, 6/5.

posts.post_content:
Why does anyone rate this less than five?  
I mean, I know, undercosted, but I don't think that's any reason to rate it less than five.  
However, I can understand rating things like [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) less than five.  
The difference here is that if the metagame is a China shop, Time Walk is a rampaging Beast that WoTC accidentally let out of its cage in the China shop, and Baneslayer is a guy with a large club that WoTC paid to go destroy the China shop.
